rev.comment: minor formatting fix: removing blank space
rev.diff:
Line 11: Line 11:
HD Super AMOLED is a new Super AMOLED type display from Samsung. The first device to use an HD Super AMOLED is the Galaxy Note: an Android v2.3 phone with a 5.3" 1280x800 display. The phone (and the display) was announced in September 2011. The second HD Super AMOLED device is Samsung's Galaxy Nexus phone - with a 4.65" display featuring 1280x720 resolution.<ref>http://www.oled-info.com/super-amoled-hd</ref> The higher [[Display resolution|resolution]] and [[Dots per inch|dpi]] were made possible due to a move from the Fine-Metal-Mask (FMM) to Laser-Induced-Thermal-Imaging (LITI) process<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oled-info.com/super-amoled-plus-resolution-further-details|publisher=Oled-Info.com|title=Super AMOLED Plus resolution - further details|accessdate=3 September 2011}}</ref> . However, the move to LITI required a change back to Pentile RGBG subpixels.
HD Super AMOLED is a new Super AMOLED type display from Samsung. The first device to use an HD Super AMOLED is the Galaxy Note: an Android v2.3 phone with a 5.3" 1280x800 display. The phone (and the display) was announced in September 2011. The second HD Super AMOLED device is Samsung's Galaxy Nexus phone - with a 4.65" display featuring 1280x720 resolution.<ref>http://www.oled-info.com/super-amoled-hd</ref> The higher [[Display resolution|resolution]] and [[Dots per inch|dpi]] were made possible due to a move from the Fine-Metal-Mask (FMM) to Laser-Induced-Thermal-Imaging (LITI) process<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oled-info.com/super-amoled-plus-resolution-further-details|publisher=Oled-Info.com|title=Super AMOLED Plus resolution - further details|accessdate=3 September 2011}}</ref> . However, the move to LITI required a change back to Pentile RGBG subpixels.
â  
Samsung is expected to develop this screen to the better Samsung "Real Stripe" RGB RGB subpixels along with the LITI technology. This may be called "HD Super Amoled Plus".
Samsung is expected to develop this screen to the better Samsung "Real Stripe" RGB RGB subpixels along with the LITI technology. This may be called "HD Super Amoled Plus".
